summary.p: 12 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 129; Qurʾānic Text: Q 3:53-3:92, Q 5:47-5:107; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 420 x 323/335mm.
The fragment Arabe 371 (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 129
12 fol. 323/335×420 mm (1.3/1.25). Support: parchment, thick but transparent, smooth, with traces of scraping, of grayish-yellowish color. Writing material: black and dark brown ink.
Collation: two quires (the first one incomplete), consisting only of bifolia.
I: H1F H2F / F3H F4H.
II: H5F H6F H7F H8F / F9H F10H F11H F12H.
Text layout: 235×310/315 mm (1.34), 14 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: rather small and dense, hard to classify. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: round red dots.

Verse markers: for groups of five verses – a circle above the text line sivided into fur segments filled with red and green colors; for groups of ten verses – two to four diagonal dashes (type 1.1.1?,) in the same ink as the main text (fol. 1r, 2r and 3r).
Stitching: threads have been preserved in the punctures of the inner bifolia
Traces of old conservation: the outer bifoium of the second quire (fol. 5 and 12) has been strengthened with strips of parchment glued to the upper and lower inside parts of the fold.

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in ink on the upper margins of the sheets of the first quire fol. 5r and 12 v; numbers of verses are also marked throughout in the text.
Defects: stains especially on fol. 1, 7, 8, 12; lower margins of fol. are torn off on the outer side and stained on the inner side with gray mold(?).

Attached materials: old cardboard wrapper inscribed on fol. Ir with the old accession number “С”, brief description of the manuscripts in French “12 fueillets/ [...???] partie des ch. 3 et 5”; numbers О 59, 61”, number of lignes on the page “14 lig.”; on fol. IIv with briefspecifiation “12 fueillets\ 14 lignes” and the numbers “335” and “№ 1”.
Old accession numbers: С; 335; О 59, 61 (on the wrapper), № 1 (according to the 2nd Langlois’ inventory)
Contents:
Fol. 1r–4v. Surah 3, verses 46(53)–86(92) Incipit: [أَنزَلَتْ] وَاتَّبَعْنَا. Explicit:عَلِيم [كل الطعام] .
Fol. 5r–12v. Surah 5, verses 51(47)–106(107). Incipit: [وَمَن] لَّمْ يَحْكُم . Explicit:عَلَى [أَنَّهُمَا اسْتَحَقَّا] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 371 (BNF)".
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
